DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Person Highest Education Level Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the highest level of education the patient has completed.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dental Restoration Type Code
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The code that represents a type of dental restoration.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dental Restoration Tooth Surface Code
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The code that represents the surface of a tooth that has had a dental restoration.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dentition Number System National Dentition Code
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The values and value meanings for tooth designation.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Protocol NIDCR Identifier Number
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The National Institute of Dental and Craniofacial Research's (NIDCR) automated 5-digit identification number (through IMPAC II) for protocols that are implemented by its grantees.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dentist Dental School Graduation Date
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the date of the conferral or receipt of an academic degree or diploma marking the completion of coursework of a professional school leading to a degree in the field dentistry.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dentist Birth Date
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the date of  birth of an individual licensed for the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases in the oral cavity, adjacent tissues, and related structures.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Carious Dentin Treatment Occurrence Week Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the number of occurrences in a week (any period of seven consecutive days) of treatment of tooth decay that has invaded the dentin, the porous, yellow-hued material between the enamel and pulp of the tooth.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Carious Dentin Treatment Dental Pulp Exposure Occurrence Week Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the number of occurrences in a week (any period of seven consecutive days) of dental pulp (the richly vascularized and innervated connective tissue of mesodermal origin contained in the central cavity of a tooth and delimited by the dentin) exposure in the treatment of tooth decay that has invaded the dentin, the porous, yellow-hued material between the enamel and pulp of the tooth.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Occlusal Surface Pulpitis Carious Dentin Posterior Tooth Dental Pulp Involvement Average Percentage Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the average (statistical calculation describing the central tendency of a set of numbers) percentage (fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator) of  the number of occurrences of dental pulp involvement of the biting surfaces of the premolar and molar teeth with inflammed dental pulp, that have tooth decay that has invaded the dentin, the porous, yellow-hued material between the enamel and pulp of the tooth.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Class I Restoration Resin-Based Composite Pulpitis Tooth Dental Pulp Involvement Average Percentage Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the average (statistical calculation describing the central tendency of a set of numbers) percentage (fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator) of  the number of occurrences of involvement of the pulp of the tooth with reconstruction of the occlusal surface, resin-based composite and inflammed dental pulp.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Class I Restoration Amalgam Pulpitis Tooth Dental Pulp Involvement Average Percentage Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the type of average (statistical calculation describing the central tendency of a set of numbers) percentage (fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator) of involvement of the pulp of the tooth with reconstruction of the occlusal surface, amalgam (an alloy, typically a mix of silver, tin, and mercury, used in direct dental restorations) and inflammed dental pulp.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dental Pulp Exposure Indirect Pulp Cap Treatment Incomplete Caries Removal Carious Dentin Administered Average Percentage Value
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed of average (statistical calculation describing the central tendency of a set of numbers) percentage (fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator) related to the incomplete removal of decayed tooth that has invaded the dentin in a procedure in which exposed pulp is covered with a protective dressing to protect the pulp from additional injury and to promote healing and repair via formation of secondary dentin.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dental Pulp Exposure Direct Pulp Cap Treatment Caries Removal Carious Dentin Administered Average Percentage Value
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: a numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed of average (statistical calculation describing the central tendency of a set of numbers) percentage (fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator) related to the removal of decayed tooth that has invaded the dentin in a procedure in which exposed pulp is covered with a dressing that protects the pulp and promotes healing and repair.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Premolar Tooth Treatment Mesial Surface Buccal Surface Pulp Horn Involvement Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A yes/no question related to the involvement of the mesial (side of the tooth facing the midline), buccal (the surface of the tooth facing or in direct contact with the oral mucosa of the cheek), pulp horn (portion of the pulp chamber that extends towards a cusp) surface in treatment of premolar tooth.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: 10/6/2014 CDE versioned to use Standard Indicator VD. jc  8/19/14 Released CDE with retired VD for review. jc

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dental Pulp Exposure Endodontic Treatment Caries Removal Carious Dentin Administered Average Percentage Value
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: a numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed of average (statistical calculation describing the central tendency of a set of numbers) percentage (fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator) for administration of endodontic (dental procedures to treat disease or injury to the tooth pulp, and may include palliative treatment) dental procedures to treat disease or injury to the tooth pulp of exposed tooth pulp decayed tooth that has invaded the dentin.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Tooth 30 Treatment Mesial Surface Buccal Surface Pulp Horn Involvement Next Decision Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the type of subsequent decision (the process of making a selective intellectual judgment when presented with several complex alternatives consisting of several variables, and usually defining a course of action or an idea) for the mesial (side of the tooth facing the midline), buccal (the surface of the tooth facing or in direct contact with the oral mucosa of the cheek), pulp horn (portion of the pulp chamber that extends towards a cusp) surface involvement of the treatment of tooth 30 (the first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch as defined by the Universal tooth numbering system).

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Carious Dentin Tooth 30 Treatment Near Dental Pulp Involvement Caries Removal Next Decision Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the type of subsequent decision (the process of making a selective intellectual judgment when presented with several complex alternatives consisting of several variables, and usually defining a course of action or an idea) for removal of decayed tooth near pulp (a richly vascularized and innervated connective tissue of mesodermal origin contained in the central cavity of a tooth and delimited by the dentin) in the treament of tooth decay that has invaded the dentin for tooth number 30 (the first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch as defined by the Universal tooth numbering system).

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Carious Dentin Tooth 30 Treatment Near Dental Pulp Involvement Caries Removal Specify
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the specified therapy-related free-text field for removal of decayed tooth near pulp (a richly vascularized and innervated connective tissue of mesodermal origin contained in the central cavity of a tooth and delimited by the dentin) in the treatment of tooth decay that has invaded the dentin for tooth number 30 (the first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch as defined by the Universal tooth numbering system).

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Antimicrobial Solution Treatment Caries Removal Carious Dentin Tooth 30 Administered Treatment Administered Next Decision Type

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Antimicrobial Solution Treatment Caries Removal Carious Dentin Tooth 30 Administered Specify
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the free-text field for the treatment with antimicrobial solution in the removal of decayed tooth material that has invaded the dentin in tooth number 30 (the first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch).

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Caries Removal Treatment Carious Dentin Tooth 30 Administered Next Decision Type

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Caries Removal Carious Dentin Tooth 30 Treatment Transitory Postoperative Hypersensitivity Event Average Percentage Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the average (statistical calculation describing the central tendency of a set of numbers) percentage (fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator) of  the number of occurrences of transient postoperative hypersensitivity (exaggerated response by the immune system) response from removal of decay that has invaded dentin of tooth number 30 (the first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch).

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dental Professional Practice Resin-Based Composite Hypersensitivity Occurrence Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: an indicator for the occurrence of an exaggerated response by the immune system to a dental restorative material made up of disparate or separate parts (e.g., resin and quartz particles) in a health care professional business directed towards treatment and care of patients pertaining to a tooth or teeth, or to odontology.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dental Professional Practice Class I Restoration Hypersensitivity Occurrence Percentage Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the percentage (a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator) type of occurrence of an exaggerated response by the immune system to reconstruction of the occlusal surface of a tooth in a health care professional business directed towards treatment and care of patients pertaining to a tooth or teeth, or to odontology.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dental Professional Practice Class I Restoration Hypersensitivity Occurrence Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the number of occurrences of an exaggerated response by the immune system to reconstruction of the occlusal surface of a tooth in a health care professional business directed towards treatment and care of patients pertaining to a tooth or teeth, or to odontology.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dental Professional Practice Self-Etching Bonding System Resin-Based Composite Use Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: an indicator for use of an acid to condition tooth dentin, resulting in a superficial demineralization of dentin, with a dental restorative material made up of disparate or separate parts (e.g., resin and quartz particles) in a health care professional business directed towards treatment and care of patients pertaining to a tooth or teeth, or to odontology.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dental Professional Practice Resin Modified Glass Ionomer Liner Use Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: an indicator for the use of a dental restorative material made up of disparate or separate parts (e.g., resin and quartz particles) in a glass polyalkenoate cement (a fluoride-containing aluminosilicate glass powder) used as a liner/base for other restoration materials in a health care professional business directed towards treatment and care of patients pertaining to a tooth or teeth, or to odontology.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dental Professional Practice Pregnancy Female Patient Comprehensive Care Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: an indicator for planned, non-emergency care that includes prevention and maintance and restoration of health for pregnant female patients and a health care professional business directed towards treatment and care of patients pertaining to a tooth or teeth, or to odontology.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dental Professional Practice Pregnancy Female Patient Emergency Care Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: an indicator for care necessary to treat acute pain, infection, bleeding, or trauma for pregnant female patients and a health care professional business directed towards treatment and care of patients pertaining to a tooth or teeth, or to odontology.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dental Professional Practice Pregnancy Female Patient Demographics Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the number of occurrences of something within a given time period in relation to the statistical characterization of pregnant female patients in a health care professional business directed towards treatment and care of patients pertaining to a tooth or teeth, or to odontology.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Pregnancy Female Patient Therapy State Guidelines Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: an indicator for the state treatment guidelines for pregnant female patients.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Porcelain Veneer Dental Professional Practice Month Use Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the number of occurrences of something within a given time period of the monthly use of a restoration consisting of a layer of tooth-colored porcelain material cemented to the surface of a tooth in a health care professional business directed towards treatment and care of patients pertaining to a tooth or teeth, or to odontology.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Porcelain Veneer Dental Professional Practice Failure Occurrence Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: an indicator for the occurrence or rate of failure of a restoration consisting of a layer of tooth-colored porcelain material cemented to the surface of a tooth in a health care professional business directed towards treatment and care of patients pertaining to a tooth or teeth, or to odontology.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Porcelain Veneer Dental Professional Practice Acid Etching Use Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: indicator for the use of an acid to condition tooth structure, resulting in a superficial demineralization with a restoration consisting of a layer of tooth-colored porcelain material cemented to the surface of a tooth in a health care professional business directed towards treatment and care of patients pertaining to a tooth or teeth, or to odontology.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Porcelain Veneer Dental Professional Practice Microetching Use Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: an indicator for the use of a method of roughening the surface of a natural tooth or a dental restoration, most likely the inside of a metal crown or the facial side of a metal crown to prepare it for repair, utilizing a gas-impelled jet of a fine abrasive with a restoration consisting of a layer of tooth-colored porcelain material cemented to the surface of a tooth in a health care professional business directed towards treatment and care of patients pertaining to a tooth or teeth, or to odontology.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Porcelain Veneer Microetching Acid Etching Use Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: an indicator for the use of a method of roughening the surface of a natural tooth or a dental restoration, most likely the inside of a metal crown or the facial side of a metal crown to prepare it for repair, utilizing a gas-impelled jet of a fine abrasive and use of an acid to condition tooth structure, resulting in a superficial demineralization with a restoration consisting of a layer of tooth-colored porcelain material cemented to the surface of a tooth.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Residual Carious Dentin Incomplete Caries Removal Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: an indicator for incomplete removal of tooth decay that has invaded the dentin, the porous, yellow-hued material between the enamel and pulp of the tooth.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Residual Carious Dentin Indirect Pulp Cap Therapy Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the type of procedure in which the tooth decay invasion has nearly exposed pulp is covered with a protective dressing to protect the pulp from additional injury and to promote healing and repair via formation of secondary dentin.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Residual Carious Dentin Direct Pulp Cap Therapy Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the type of procedure in which the tooth decay invasion exposed pulp is covered with a dressing that protects the pulp and promotes healing and repair.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Residual Carious Dentin Complete Caries Removal Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: an indicator for complete removal of tooth decay that has invaded the dentin, the porous, yellow-hued material between the enamel and pulp of the tooth.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dental Professional Practice Current Smoking Cessation Program Use Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: an indicator for a smoking cessation program designed to discontinue the habit of smoking being used in a health care professional business directed towards treatment and care of patients pertaining to a tooth or teeth, or to odontology.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dental Professional Practice Smoking Cessation Program Begin Use Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: an indicator for beginning the use of a smoking cessation program designed to discontinue the habit of smoking in a health care professional business directed towards treatment and care of patients pertaining to a tooth or teeth, or to odontology.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Current Smoking Cessation Program Participating Percentage Value
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: a numerical quantity as measured in a fraction or ratio of patient/participant participating in a smoking cessation program designed to discontinue the habit of smoking.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: State Dental License Smoking Cessation Program Requirement Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: an indicator of a smoking cessation program designed to discontinue the habit of smoking a part of the requirement for the legal right to practice dentistry in a particular state.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Caries Visual Classification Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: an indicator for the visual classification or identification of  decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Caries Risk Medical Record Assessment Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: an indicator for the assessment of the medical record or account of a patient's examination and treatment that includes the patient's medical history and complaints for the potential future harm of  decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Caries Tooth Remineralization Program Therapy Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: an indicator of the program to restore lost mineral constituents to the enamel, dentin, or cementum as treatment for the decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Crack Posterior Tooth Therapy Month Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the number of occurrence of something within a given time period of a month (one of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar) of treatment for a patient/participant of a break or fissure in a tooth towards the back of the mouth (distal to the canines): maxillary and mandibular premolars and molars.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Crack Posterior Tooth Routine Diagnosis Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: an indicator of the break or fissure in a tooth towards the back of the mouth (distal to the canines): maxillary and mandibular premolars and molars as routine or common diagnosis.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Crack Posterior Tooth Diagnosis Method Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the type of method or technique used to diagnosis or identify a break or fissure in a tooth towards the back of the mouth (distal to the canines): maxillary and mandibular premolars and molars.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Pediatric Sealant Routine Performed Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: an indicator of a resinous material designed to be applied to the occlusal surfaces of posterior teeth to prevent occlusal decay by filling in the fissures and/or crevices of the pediatric or child tooth performed as a routine procedure.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Adolescent Sealant Routine Performed Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: an indicator a resinous material designed to be applied to the occlusal surfaces of posterior teeth to prevent occlusal decay by filling in the fissures and/or crevices of the adolescent or juvenile tooth performed as a routine procedure.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dye Sealant Leakage Use Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: an indicator of the use of chemical substances that are used to stain and color leakage in the resinous material applied to the occlusal surfaces of posterior teeth to prevent occlusal decay by filling in the fissures and/or crevices of the tooth.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dye Sealant Leakage Modification Use Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: an indicator of the modification of the use of chemical substances that are used to stain and color leakage in the resinous material applied to the occlusal surfaces of posterior teeth to prevent occlusal decay by filling in the fissures and/or crevices of the tooth.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Tooth Radiograph Occlusal Surface Caries Diagnosis Percent Range Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A range of percentages used to the represent the number of patients in which an image of the tooth structure penetrated by radiation is used in the process of identifying decay on the   biting surface of the premolar and molar teeth containing an area of abnormal tissue change in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Tooth Radiograph Proximal Surface Caries Diagnosis Percent Range Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A range of percentages used to the represent the number of patients in which an image of the tooth structure penetrated by the radiation is used in the process of identifying decay on the [proximal surface] containing an area of abnormal tissue change in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dental Explorer Occlusal Surface Primary Caries Diagnosis Percent Range Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The range of percentages used to describe the number of patients in which a dental hand-held instrument that is used for exploring the tooth surface is used in the process of identifying the primary decay in the biting surfaces of the premolar and molar teeth occurring first in time and containing an area of abnormal tissue change in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dental Explorer  Occlusal Surface Recurrent Caries Diagnosis Percent Range Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The range of percentages used to describe the number of patients in which a dental hand-held instrument that is used for exploring the tooth surface is used in the process of identifying the decay occurring again on the biting surfaces of the premolar and molar teeth containing an area of abnormal tissue change in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Laser Fluroescence Occlusal Surface Primary Caries  Diagnosis Percent Range Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A range of percentages that describes the number of times a method used to aid in the detection of tooth decay by measuring fluorescence using a laser is used in the process of identifying  decay occurring for the first time on the biting surfaces of the premolar and molar teeth containing an area of abnormal tissue change in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous is utilized.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Fiber Optic Transilluminator Proximal Surface Caries Diagnosis Percent Range Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A light, with glass or plastic fibers which have special optical properties usually attached to a dental handpiece that is intended to illuminate oral structures. is used in the process of identifying decay on the surface of a tooth that is adjacent to the next tooth containing an area of abnormal tissue change in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Tooth Magnifier Caries Diagnosis Percent Range Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The range of percentages used to describe the number of patients in which an optical device that  magnifies is used in the rocess of identifying decay on a tooth containing an area of abnormal tissue change in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous. is used in the rocess of identifying decay on a tooth containing an area of abnormal tissue change in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Pediatric Dental Sealant Occlusal Surface Permanent Tooth Administration Percent Range Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A range of percentages that describes the number of times a resinous material designed to prevent occlusal decay by filling in the fissures and/or crevices of the tooth to the biting surfaces of the permanent premolar or molar tooth of a 6 to 18 years old patien was applied.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Pediatric Fluoride Dental Operatory Administration Percent Range Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A range of percentages that describes the number of times a chemical that helps prevent tooth decay is applied to the tooth of a 6 to 18 years old patient during a visit to  the office of a dental professional.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Pediatric  Non-Prescription  Fluoride  Recommendation Percent Range Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A range of percentages that describes the number of 6 to 18 years old patient is advised to use a chemical that helps prevent tooth decay that can be sold legally without a prescription by this dentist.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Pediatric Prescription Fluoride Recommendation Percent Range Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A range of percentages that describes the number of times 6 to 18 years old patients are advised to use a chemical that helps prevent tooth decay that is a dentist's order for intervention by this dentist.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Pediatric Chlorhexidine Recommendation Percent Range Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A range of percentages that describes the number of 6 to 18 years old patients advised to  use a disinfectant and topical anti-infective mouthwash to prevent oral plaque by this dentist.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Pediatric  Xylitol Chewing Gum Recommendation Percent Range Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A range of percentages that describes the number of  6 to 18 years old patients advised to  use a sugarless or xylitol chewing gum intended to prevent dental caries by this dentist.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Adult Dental Sealant Occlusal Surface Tooth Administration Percent Range Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The range of percentages used to describe the number of   patients more than 18 years old in which a resinous material designed to prevent occlusal decay by filling in the fissures and/or crevices of the tooth is applied to the biting surfaces of their premolar or molar tooth.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Adult Fluoride Dental Operatory Administration Percent Range Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The range of percentages used to describe the number of patients more than 18 years old in which a chemical that helps prevent tooth decay is applied to their tooth during a visit to the office of a dental professional.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Adult  Non-Prescription Fluoride Recommendation Percent Range Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The range of percentages used to describe the number of  patients more than 18 years who are advised to use a chemical that helps prevent tooth decay that can be sold legally without a prescription.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Adult  Prescription Fluoride Recommendation Percent Range Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The range of percentages used to describe the number of  patients more than 18 years who are advised to use a chemical that helps prevent tooth decay that is a dentist's order for intervention.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Adult Chlorhexidine Recommendation Percent Range Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The range of percentages used to describe the number of  patients more than 18 years who are advised to  use a disinfectant and topical anti-infective mouthwash to prevent oral plaque.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Adult  Xylitol Chewing Gum Recommendation Percent Range Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The range of percentages used to describe the number of  patients more than 18 years who are advised to use a sugarless or xylitol chewing gum intended to prevent dental caries.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Risk Assessment Caries Answer Code
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories that represents the reponse to a question about the dentist's qualitative or quantitative estimation of the likelihood of adverse effects that may result from the decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Non-carious  Dental Restoration Administration Reason
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: An explanation that describes why a replacement for a lost tooth strructure was placed on a non-carious tooth of the patient.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Pediatric Dental Treatment Plan Active Caries Importance Weight Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The text that describes the relative importance of one or more tooth decay that is increasing in size or scope on the outline of the clinical steps in the care of a  6 to 18 years old dental patient that may include specific services to be delivered, the frequency of services, expected duration/timing, and costs.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Pediatric  Dental Treatment Plan Recent Caries Importance Weight Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The text that describes the relative importance of a recent localized destruction of calcified tissue initiated on the tooth surface by decalcification of the enamel of the teeth, followed by enzymatic lysis of organic structures, leading to cavity formation that, if left untreated penetrates the enamel and dentin and may reach the pulp on the outline of the clinical steps in the care of a  6 to 18 years old dental patient that may include specific services to be delivered, the frequency of services, expected duration/timing, and costs.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The text that describes the relative importance of current the practice of keeping the mouth, teeth, and gums clean and healthy to prevent disease, as by regular brushing and flossing and visits to a dentist on an outline of the clinical steps in the care of a 6 to 18 years old dental patient that may include specific services to be delivered, the frequency of services, expected duration/timing, and costs.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The text that describes the relative importance of the availability of a a device to repair teeth or replace missing teeth on the an outline of the clinical steps in the care of a 6 to 18 years old dental patient that may include specific services to be delivered, the frequency of services, expected duration/timing, and costs.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The period of time during which the tooth is dried by exposure to forced air in seconds.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Caries Preventive Intervention Patient Individualized Therapy Percent Range Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The range of percentages used to describe the number of patients whose interest in the individualized therapeutic, and or behavioral interventions at individual levels to reduce, modify or stop the course of the decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous justifies dentist's recommendation.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Caries Preventive Intervention Individualized Therapy Percent Range Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The range of percentages used to describe the number of patients a dentist recommends individualized therapeutic, and or behavioral interventions at individual levels for their needs.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dentist Statement Agreement Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The text that describes the strength of agreement to the written message "dentist's assessment of caries risk for an individual patient can predict whether or not that patient develops new caries in the future"?

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Gingival Margin Dental Restoration Therapy Recurrent Caries Tooth  9 Recommendation Therapy Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The text that describes the type of treatment a dentist advises with the intention of providing restoration of the decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous ocurring again on the crest of the gingiva surrounding tooth 9.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Gingival Margin Dental Restoration Therapy Recurrent Caries Tooth  9 Recommendation Therapies Specify
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A short text field that describes another treatment a dentist advises with the intended to provide a restoration of the decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous ocurring again on the crest of the gingiva surrounding a tooth 9.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dental Restoration Mesial Surface Therapy Recurrent Caries Tooth #11Recommendation Therapy Type

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Permanent Dental Restoration Amalgam Therapy Mesial-Occlusal-Lingual Surface Tooth 19 Recommendation Therapy Type

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Permanent Dental Restoration Therapy Administration Caries Depth Code
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A code that describes the depth of a caries for which an application of a replacement for a lost tooth structure designed for continued or prolonged use was done.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Permanent Dental Restoration Therapy Plaque Dental Calculus White Spot Lesion Administration Depth Code
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The application of a restoration which is designed to remain in place for a long time and seal the tooth on which there is a film attached to it, causing dental caries and gingivitis and the presence of an abnormal concretion or calcified deposit that is formed around the tooth with class V white spot lesions in a 30-year female old patient with no missing teeth._A code that describes the depth of a caries.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Molar Tooth Therapy Minimum Tooth discolouration Dental Fissure Recommendation Therapy Type

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Lower Jaw Molar Tooth Therapy Tooth discolouration Dental Fissure Involvement Recommendation Therapy Type

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Mandible Molar Tooth Therapy Tooth discolouration Dental Fissure Involvement Recommendation Therapy Type

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Molar Tooth Therapy discolouration Dental Fissure Caries Recommendation Therapy Type

DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The free text field related to a dentist being specific about other administrations of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to provide a restoration that is being advised.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dental Restoration Treatment Twelve Plaque Dental Calculus Class V white Spot Lesion Recommendation Therapy Type

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Tooth Picture Dental Disorder Case Description Type

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Practice-Based Research Collaborative in Evidence-Based  Dentistry Dentist Identifier Number
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Number consisting of one or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of an individual licensed for the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases in the oral cavity, adjacent tissues, and related structures within a network of dental practices that will establish the  infrastructure to perform a wide variety of oral health research studies  in Idaho, Montana, Oregon, Utah and Washington.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Visit Most Recent Date
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A particular day specified as the time something has happened, nearest to the present day on which a person who requires medical care goes to see some person or place or thing for a short time.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Tooth Attrition Present Count
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: To determine the number or amount of  the existence of wearing away of a tooth (an organ, the organ parts of which primarily consist of dentine and dental enamel; together with other teeth it constitutes a subdivision of the facial skeleton. Example(s): incisor, molar) as a result of tooth-to-tooth contact, as in mastication, occurring only on the occlusal, incisal, and proximal surfaces. It is chiefly associated with aging. It is differentiated from TOOTH ABRASION (the pathologic wearing away of the tooth substance by friction, as brushing, bruxism, clenching, and other mechanical causes) and from TOOTH EROSION (the loss of substance caused by chemical action without bacterial action). (Jablonski, Dictionary of Dentistry, 1992, p86)

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Agent Administered Occurrence Text
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the free-text field related to the occurrence of administration of an agent.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Cold Sore Canker Sore Post-Treatment Development Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard to describe the act, or process, of natural progression in physical and psychological maturation from a previous, lower, or embryonic stage to a later, more complex, or adult stage of a lesion caused by type 1 or type 2 herpes simplex virus, involving the oralfacial region or recurrent disease of the oral mucosa of unknown etiology. It is characterized by small white ulcerative  lesions, single or multiple, round or oval, lasting for 7-14 days and healing without scarring, after treatment, by a person who requires medical care.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Visit Reason
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of a person who requires medical care going to see some person or place or thing for a short time.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Left Side Dental Occlusion Assessment Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities for the final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of the relationship of all the components of the masticatory system in normal function; has special reference to the position and contact of the maxillary and mandibular teeth for the highest efficiency during the excursive movements of the jaw that are essential for mastication on the left (being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north) side (one of the two lateral margins or surfaces of a body, midway between the front and back).

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Right Side Dental Occlusion Assessment Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of the relationship of all the components of the masticatory system in normal function; has special reference to the position and contact of the maxillary and mandibular teeth for the highest efficiency during the excursive movements of the jaw that are essential for mastication on the right (being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north) side (one of the two lateral margins or surfaces of a body, midway between the front and back)._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Open Bite Canine Tooth Present Ind-4
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable for there being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time a condition in which certain opposing teeth fail to establish occlusal contact when the jaws are closed in one of the four pointed conical teeth (two in each jaw) located between the incisors and the premolars.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Open Bite Molar Tooth Bicuspid Tooth Present Ind-4
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable for there being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time a condition in which certain opposing teeth fail to establish occlusal contact when the jaws are closed in a grinding tooth with a broad crown; located behind the premolars or in one of the two permanent teeth located in front of the molars and behind each cuspid. These teeth have two cusps (points) and are used to tear and grind food.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dentition, Mixed Clinical Tooth Crowding Present Ind-4
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable for there being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time a condition in which the summation of the mesio distal width of the teeth is larger than the arch perimeter in the complement of teeth in the jaws after the eruption of some of the permanent teeth but before all the deciduous teeth are absent (Boucher"s Clinical Dental Terminology, 4th ed) relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Temporary Tooth Spacing Present Ind-4
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable for there being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time a condition in which there is an intervening interval of space or time in any of the teeth of the first dentition, which are usually shed and replaced by the permanent teeth.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Intraoral Appliance Personal Medical History Yes No Unknown Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes, No, or Unknown to represent a condition of an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced who requires medical care regarding any device worn within the mouth that can be removed and is not primarily designed to replace teeth.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Intraoral Appliance Personal Medical History Reason
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced who requires medical care regarding any device worn within the mouth that can be removed and is not primarily designed to replace teeth.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Gingivitis Present Ind-3
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no as to the existence of a disorder involving inflammation of the gums; may affect surrounding and supporting structures of the teeth in a person who requires medical care.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Gingivitis Past Year Personal Medical History Yes No Unknown Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes, No, or Unknown to represent a condition of the existence of a disorder involving inflammation of the gums; may affect surrounding and supporting structures of the teeth in a person who requires medical care occurring before the period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period in a record of a patient"s background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual.  In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Periodontal disease Past Year Personal Medical History Yes No Unknown Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes, No, or Unknown to represent a condition in which there is a deviation from or interruption of the normal structure or function of the tissues that support, attach, and surround the teeth in a person who requires medical care occurring before the period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period in a record of a patient"s background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual.  In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Leukoplakia Past Year Personal Medical History Yes No Unknown Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes, No, or Unknown to represent a condition of a white patch or plaque on a mucous membrane that cannot be characterized clinically or pathologically as any other disease. The diagnosis of leukoplakia is one of exclusion; other conditions such as candidiasis, lichen planus, leukoedema, etc. must be ruled out before a diagnosis of leukoplakia can be made. Leukoplakia may be a premalignant condition --2004 in a person who requires medical care occurring before the period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period in a record of a patient"s background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual.  In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Malignant Oral Cavity Neoplasm Past Year Personal Medical History Yes No Unknown Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes, No, or Unknown to represent a condition of a primary or metastatic malignant tumor involving the oral cavity.  The majority are squamous cell carcinomas -- 2003 in a person who requires medical care occurring before the period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period in a record of a patient"s background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual.  In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Face pain Past Year Personal Medical History Yes No Unknown Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes, No, or Unknown to represent a condition of pain in the facial region including orofacial pain and craniofacial pain. Associated conditions include local inflammatory and neoplastic disorders and neuralgic syndromes involving the trigeminal, facial, and glossopharyngeal nerves. Conditions which feature recurrent or persistent facial pain as the primary manifestation of disease are referred to as FACIAL PAIN SYNDROMES in a person who requires medical care occurring before the period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period in a record of a patient"s background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual.  In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Tooth Periodontal Pocket Greater Than Three Millimeter Present Count
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: An organ, the organ parts of which primarily consist of dentine and dental enamel; together with other teeth it constitutes a subdivision of the facial skeleton. Example(s): incisor, molar, with an abnormal deepening of a gingival sulcus of relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status that is a natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one in a unit of measure equaling one thousandth of a meter (NCI) being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time, to determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Diseases and Disorders Patient Self-Report Human Immunodeficiency Virus Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome Diagnosis Yes No Unknown Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A yes/no/unknown indicator for the person self-report of a diagnosis by a physician of Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV), a virus isolated and recognized as the etiologic agent of AIDS. HIV-1 is classified as a lentivirus, a subtype of retroviruses, and/or as Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome (AIDS), a syndrome resulting from the acquired deficiency of cellular immunity caused by HIV and is characterized by the reduction of the Helper T-lymphocytes in the peripheral blood and the lymph nodes, an abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Glaucoma Patient Self-Report Personal Medical History Yes or No Response
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: An ocular disease, occurring in many forms, having as its primary characteristics an unstable or a sustained increase in the intraocular pressure which the eye cannot withstand without damage to its structure or impairment of its function. The consequences of the increased pressure may be manifested in a variety of symptoms, depending upon type and severity, such as excavation of the optic disk, hardness of the eyeball, corneal anesthesia, reduced visual acuity, seeing of colored halos around lights, disturbed dark adaptation, visual field defects, and headaches. (Dictionary of Visual Science, 4th ed). Subjective reports made by a patient. An account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced. A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A periodic humming or blowing sound heard on auscultation of the heart that can indicate the presence of cardiac disease; murmurs are the result of vibrations caused by the turbulent flow of blood in the heart or great vessels. The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used. An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action. Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Cardiac Heart Personal Medical History Yes No Unknown Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function. Having to do with the heart. A hollow muscular organ which receives the blood from the veins and propels it into the arteries. It is divided by a musculomembranous septum into two halves -- right or venous and left or arterial -- each of which consists of a receiving chamber (atrium) and an ejecting chamber (ventricle). SYN cor, coeur. An account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced._the yes/no/unknown question related to the patient's history of chronic or associated diseases and exposures.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dentist Pain Therapy Medication Recommendation Scale

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dentist Pain Therapy Administer Recommendation Scale

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dentist Pain Therapy General Dentistry Specialist Recommendation Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: an ordered reference standard related to the dentist's advice for pain relief bring a dentist involved in the treatment of the oral facial disease who has not limited his/her practice to any dental specialty.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dentist Pain Therapy Other Dentist Recommendation Scale

DataElementQueryResults.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dentist Pain Therapy Other Physician Recommendation Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: an ordered reference standard related to the dentist's advice to seek care by other specialist physician for pain relief.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dentist Pain Therapy Other Recommendation Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: an ordered reference standard related to the dentist's advice to seek care by other types of pain relief.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dentist Pain Therapy Other Recommendation Specify
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the free text field related to the dentist's advice to seek care by other types of pain relief.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dentist Pain Therapy Medication Recommendation Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: a subdivision related to the dentist's advice of medication for pain relief.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dentist Pain Therapy Medication Recommendation Specify
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the free text field related to the dentist's advice of medication for pain relief.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dentist Pain Therapy Medication Opioid Recommendation Reason
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the reason related to the dentist's advice of opioid (class of synthetic chemicals/drugs similar to opiates (opium derivatives) with analgesic properties) as the medication for pain relief.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dentist Pain Therapy Medication Opioid Recommendation Specify
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the free text field related to the dentist's advice of opioid (class of synthetic chemicals/drugs similar to opiates (opium derivatives) with analgesic properties) as the medication for pain relief.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Tooth Cold Sensitivity Assessment Duration
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the period of time during which something continues related to assessment of ability to register small physical amounts or differences of cold in tooth.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Tooth Sensitivity Mastication Assessment Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A yes/no indicator related to the assessment of mastication (the process by which food is torn and/or crushed) sensitivity (the ability to respond to physical stimuli or to register small physical amounts or differences in content) in patient's hard bonelike structures in the jaws of vertebrates.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: 11/21/14 CDE versioned to use Standard Indicator VD; only CS/CSI reference to review folder. tc   8/19/14 Released CDE with retired VD for review. jc

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Tooth Crack Diagnosis Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A yes/no indicator related to break or fissure in tooth (an organ, the organ parts of which primarily consist of dentine and dental enamel) being recognized.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: 11/21/14 CDE versioned to use Standard Indicator VD; only CS/CSI reference to review folder. tc   8/19/14 Released CDE with retired VD for review. jc

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Caries Grouping Diagnosis Category
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: used informally to mean a class of things related to the evaluation of decay of a tooth by putting in a system for classifying into groups.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dental Restoration Complete Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A yes/no indicator related to finishing a dental restoration.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: 11/21/14 CDE versioned to use Standard Indicator VD; only CS/CSI reference to review folder. tc  8/18/14 Released CDE with retired VD for review. jc

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Resin Modified Glass Ionomer Liner Randomization Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A yes/no indicator related to randomization of a patient who receive a dental restorative material made up of disparate or separate parts (e.g., resin and quartz particles) in a glass polyalkenoate cement (a fluoride-containing aluminosilicate glass powder) used as a liner/base for other restoration materials.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: 11/21/14 CDE versioned to use Standard Indicator VD; only CS/CSI reference to review folder. tc   8/19/14 Released CDE with retired VD for review. jc

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Resin Modified Glass Ionomer Liner Use Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A yes/no indicator related to the use of a dental restorative material made up of disparate or separate parts (e.g., resin and quartz particles) in a glass polyalkenoate cement (a fluoride-containing aluminosilicate glass powder) used as a liner/base for other restoration materials.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: 11/21/14 CDE versioned to use Standard Indicator VD; only CS/CSI reference to review folder. tc   8/19/14 Released CDE with retired VD for review. jc

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Caries Risk Assessment Status
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: a condition or state at a particular timerelated to the patient's assessment of risk, or the potential future harm that may arise, from the decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dental Restoration Patient First Tooth Dentition Code
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the values and value meanings for tooth designation related to the dental restoration patient's first tooth being assessed.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dental Restoration Patient Second Tooth Dentition Code
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the values and value meanings for tooth designation related to the dental restoration patient's second tooth being assessed.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Diagnostic Imaging Acceptable Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A yes/no indicator related to satisfying an established set of qualifying measures in a method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: 11/21/14 CDE versioned to use Standard Indicator VD; only CS/CSI reference to review folder. tc   8/19/14 Released CDE with retired VD for review. jc

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Diagnostic Imaging Endodontic Treatment Outcome Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: a subdivision related to the result of the diagnostic imaging of the dental procedures to treat disease or injury to the tooth pulp, and may include palliative treatment.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Diagnostic Imaging Endodontic Treatment Length Assessment Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: a subdivision related to the assessment of the lenght for the diagnostic imaging of the dental procedures to treat disease or injury to the tooth pulp, and may include palliative treatment.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dental Restoration Therapy Depth Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: a subdivision to describes the extent downward or inward of the application of a replacement for a lost tooth structure designed for continued or prolonged use.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Tooth Pain Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A yes/no indicator related to the sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings for an organ, the organ parts of which primarily consist of dentine and dental enamel; together with other teeth it constitutes a subdivision of the facial skeleton.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PRECEDENT CRF:Practice-based Research Collaborative in Evidence-Based Dentistry Case Report Form
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: 11/21/2014 CDE versioned to use Standard Indicator VD; only CS/CSI reference to review folder. tc 8/19/14 Released CDE with retired VD for review. jc

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Tooth Sensitivity Occurrence Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the frequency of discomfort a participant feels due to sensitive teeth
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PRECEDENT CRF:Practice-based Research Collaborative in Evidence-Based Dentistry Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Periodontal Scaling and Root Planing Performed Time
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: At the time of the questioning, how long had it been since  scaling and root planing had occurred (categorical answers)?
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PRECEDENT CRF:Practice-based Research Collaborative in Evidence-Based Dentistry Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dental Whitening Dental Office Performed Time
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: At the time of the questioning, how long had it been since use of tooth-whitening products while in the dental office had occurred (categorical answers)?
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PRECEDENT CRF:Practice-based Research Collaborative in Evidence-Based Dentistry Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dental Whitening Home Performed Time
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: At the time of the questioning, how long had it been since use of tooth-whitening products (other than over-the-counter whitening toothpaste) while at home had occurred (categorical answers)?
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PRECEDENT CRF:Practice-based Research Collaborative in Evidence-Based Dentistry Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Tooth Sensitivity Begin Occurrence Time

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Tooth Absent Sensitivity Home Product Occurrence Time
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The time the tooth sensitivity was absent after the home use of products for sensitive teeth
DataElementQueryResults.origin: PRECEDENT CRF:Practice-based Research Collaborative in Evidence-Based Dentistry Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.origin: PRECEDENT CRF:Practice-based Research Collaborative in Evidence-Based Dentistry Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.origin: PRECEDENT CRF:Practice-based Research Collaborative in Evidence-Based Dentistry Case Report Form

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Tooth Non-carious tissue change Present Indicator

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Tooth Gingival Recession Present Indicator
